citation.article-title: Variovorax dokdonensis sp. nov., isolated from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Variovorax dokdonensis sp. nov.
Variovorax dokdonensis (dok.do.nen′sis. N.L. masc. adj. dokdonensis of Dokdo, a Korean island, from where the organism was isolated).
Cells are Gram-negative and oval- or rod-shaped (0·3–0·5 μm×0·7–2·8 μm).
Colonies on TSA are circular, slightly convex, smooth, glistening, pale yellow in colour and 1·0–2·0 mm in diameter after 3 days incubation at 30 °C.
Growth occurs at 10 and 40 °C, but not at 4 or 41 °C.
Optimal pH for growth is 7·0–8·0; growth occurs at pH 5·0 and 9·5, but not at pH 4·5 or 10·0.
Growth occurs in the presence of 0–5 % (w/v) NaCl; optimal growth occurs in the presence of 0·5 % (w/v) NaCl.
Anaerobic growth does not occur on TSA or on TSA supplemented with nitrate.
Hypoxanthine and Tweens 20, 40 and 60 are hydrolysed, but aesculin, casein, l-tyrosine and xanthine are not.
H2S and indole are not produced.
N-Acetylglucosamine and malate are not utilized.
Arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and tryptophan deaminase are absent.

In assays with the API ZYM system, alkaline phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are present and α-glucosidase is weakly present, but lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase are absent.
The major fatty acids are C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH, C18 : 1ω7c and C17 : 0 cyclo.
The DNA G+C content is 66·0 mol% (determined by HPLC).
Other phenotypic characteristics are given in Table 1.
The type strain, DS-43T (=KCTC 12544T=CIP 108838T), was isolated from soil from Dokdo, Korea.
